chargeHist.descr: Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Michael R. Benedict in court.  Attorney Mackenzie Renner in court for Michael R. Benedict.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.

Defendant Michael R. Benedict not in court.  Attorney Mackenzie Renner in court for Michael R. Benedict.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant's ride fell through. Defendant must be present at next hearing. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved.

2:34pm Court in session

Defendant Michael Benedict present in court with attorney Mackenzie Renner. Andrew Herrmann appears for the State of Wisconsin.
State calls Detective Trevor Hinman, duly sworn & testifies on direct by ADA Herrmann. Detective Hinman identifies the Deft by where he's seated & what he's wearing, no objection by Atty Renner. 
State introduces previously marked exhibit #1, amended criminal complaint, into evidence. Subject to cross, no objection by Atty Renner.
Cross-Exam by Atty Renner
No re-direct.
State rests. 
Atty Renner objects for the record to the Court receiving exhibit #1
Court notes objection however will receive exhibit #1 into evidence.

Evidence is closed.

Argument by the State
Argument by Atty Renner

Court finds probable cause that a felony has been committed & that the Deft likely committed it & binds him over to stand trial on the charges

Information will mirror the complaint. 
Defense wishes to proceed to arraignment

2:46pm Court in recess
Status conference scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Prosecuting attorney Zeke S Wiedenfeld in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael R. Benedict in court, in custody by video.  Attorney Mackenzie Renner in court for Michael R. Benedict. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Preliminary rights given and hearing requested. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Mackenzie Renner
Signature bond filed. Defendant refused to sign.

TOTAL BOND TO COVER 22CF14, 22CM40, 22CT42, 21CT38, 21CM717 & 21CM549

DEFENDANT MUST POST $2000 CASH 

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Not to operate a motor vehicle without an IID installed. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH B.C.S. dob 4-15-1991. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael R. Benedict in court, in custody by video. Attorney Mackenzie Renner appeared. New total bond set. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Original Warrant filed with the court.
